item.title: Bridget add a quote by Robert Frost
item.description: "No tears in the writer, no tears in the reader. No surprise in the writer, no surprise in the reader." -- Robert Frost

item.title: Bridget add a quote by William Carlos Williams
item.description: "It is difficult to get the news from poems, yet men die miserably every day for lack of what is found there." -- William Carlos Williams

item.title: Bridget add a quote by Walt Whitman
item.description: "Failing to fetch me at first, keep encouraged. Missing me one place, search another. I stop somewhere waiting for you." -- Walt Whitman

item.title: Bridget add a quote by Kobayashi Issa
item.description: "What a strange thing! to be alive beneath cherry blossoms." -- Kobayashi Issa

item.title: Bridget add a quote by Pablo Neruda
item.description: "I love you as certain dark things are to be loved, in secret, between the shadow and the soul." -- Pablo Neruda

item.title: Bridget add a quote by Robert Graves
item.description: "There's no money in poetry, but there's no poetry in money, either." -- Robert Graves

item.title: Bridget add a quote by Octavio Paz
item.description: "No one behind, no one ahead. The path the ancients cleared has closed. And the other path, everyone's path, easy and wide, goes nowhere. I am alone and find my way." -- Octavio Paz

item.title: Bridget add a quote by octavio paz
Bridget add a quote by Ralph Ellison
item.description: "Good fiction is made of that which is real, and reality is difficult to come by." -- Ralph Ellison

item.title: Bridget add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "Everybody is a genius. But if you judge a fish by its ability to climb a tree, it will live its whole life believing that it is stupid." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Bridget add a quote by Sherrilyn Kenyon
item.description: "I learned the bad guys are not always bad, the good guys are not always good, and to quote Captain Barbossa, the parameters are like rules, mostly guidelines. And that it takes a little bit of bad boy to fight the evil in the world. --Terri Mitchell" -- Sherrilyn Kenyon
